caption.title: Illustration of the transmission model.
caption.p:
The transmission model divides the population into 9 states ( Treated High Risk, Treated Low Risk, Chronic High Risk, Chronic Low Risk, Actue High Risk, Acute Low Risk, Susceptible High Risk, Susceptible Low Risk, and Protected) represented by boxes. Flows between states are represented as arrows. Symbols represent rate coefficients and model parameters. The term ϕ
H and ϕ
L are complex terms involving both sexual mixing and contact rate terms.
